entry.title: Germany CSD Oct 28th ‚Äì Joule for SAP Ariba & Fieldglass is here, get prepared to leverage it!
entry.content:
Joule SAP Copilot is now available for Spend Management, with initial skills released in Q3 and additional enhancements expected in Q4 and 2026*. Are you prepared to activate these new features?

Furthermore, SAP Ariba and Fieldglass solutions include embedded AI capabilities that can be enabled now.

If you are attending Oct 28th Customer Success Day ‚Äì Spend Management in Garching I invite you to join the ‚ÄúJoule & AI: Configuration & Prerequisites‚Äù workshop at 15:30 to gain a comprehensive overview of Joule enablement steps.

I will also be present throughout the full day event and available to discuss further during networking breaks.

In the meantime, please review the following informative blogs on this topic:

  • Unlocking the Potential of SAP AI in Procurement
  • Joule in SAP Ariba Applications
  • Configure Single-Sign-On for SAP Ariba with SAP Cloud Identity Services

Why to Attend This Session?

  • Stay Ahead of the Curve: Get the first look at Joule‚Äîthe new SAP AI Copilot‚Äîand its skills for SAP Ariba and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Unified Experience Across SAP Solutions: Learn how Cloud Identity Services streamline authentication for your users, delivering a secure and harmonious login experience.
  • Unlock Embedded AI: See how AI capabilities are already working behind the scenes in SAP Ariba Category Management, Guided Sourcing, Guided Buying, and SAP Fieldglass.
  • Direct Access to Experts: Register for Customer Drop-in Sessions to dive deeper, ask questions, and get personalized support for your journey.

Who Should Attend?
If you are a procurement professional, IT leader, business analyst, or simply passionate about digital transformation, this session will bring you fresh insights and hands-on guidance. Come with your questions and your curiosity.

Let‚Äôs unlock what‚Äôs possible with AI for SAP Ariba and Fieldglass‚Äîsee you in Garching!

*Legal Disclaimer: The information in this document is not a commitment, promise, or legal obligation to deliver any material, code, or functionality. This document is provided without a warranty of any kind‚Ä¶ Read more

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching‚Äîthe premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

üîóExplore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center‚Äôs AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

üîóCalculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

üîóExplore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

üîóAccess the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

üîóDiscover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with six new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

üöÄActivate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
üöÄSetup of Joule in Mobile Start
üöÄAccelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
üöÄMigrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
üöÄAccelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack
üöÄExtend SAP SuccessFactors HCM Solutions with Mobile App

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

üîó Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform ‚Äì Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

üîóhttps://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just features‚Äîthey're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025‚Äîmake it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP‚Äôs New Logistics Management Module: A Cloud-Native Approach to Smarter Regional Supply Chains
entry.content:
At SAP Connect 2025 in Los Angeles, SAP unveiled a number of innovations in the supply chain space and one of the most notable is SAP Logistics Management, a new cloud-native solution designed to streamline and unify logistics operations  across warehouses, transportation, and logistics partners.

This launch reflects SAP‚Äôs strategy to simplify logistics for distributed and regional operations while enabling real-time visibility, automation, and collaboration across the supply chain network.

In this blog post, I will take you through what the module is, what its capabilities are, how it fits into the SAP ecosystem, and what it means for companies looking to modernise their logistics operations and all within one intelligent cloud platform.

Read the full blog to explore features, business impact, and practical steps to prepare your logistics operations for the next generation of SAP innovation.

What Is SAP Logistics Management?

SAP Logistics Management is a modern SaaS-based logistics solution built on the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP).
It brings together warehousing, transportation management, and partner collaboration in a single, integrated system ‚Äî particularly suited for regional or satellite operations  while connecting seamlessly with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Network.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Key Attributes

  • Cloud-native: Designed for seamless scalability, continuous innovation, and rapid deployment.
  • Unified logistics approach: Combines warehouse, transport execution, orchestration, and partner collaboration into one platform.
  • Native ERP integration: Connects easily with SAP Cloud ERP and SAP S/4HANA without heavy customisation.
  • Carrier & partner collaboration: Built-in connectivity through the SAP Business Network for real-time visibility and data sharing.
  • AI-powered operations (Joule): Leverages SAP Joule AI assistants to automate tasks, guide decisions, and reduce manual workload.

In short, SAP Logistics Management doesn‚Äôt replace heavy-duty logistics systems like SAP EWM or SAP TM, but rather extends SAP‚Äôs portfolio with a lighter, agile, intelligent logistics layer ideal for regional warehouses and distributed networks.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Image Source: SAP Product Information Page (sap.com)

Core Capabilities & Business Impact

 

Function

Business Impact

Warehouse & transport execution

Reduces manual coordination and errors

Real-time visibility

Enables proactive decision-making

Dock & appointment scheduling

Improves yard efficiency

AI-guided automation

Speeds up repetitive tasks

Integrated partner collaboration

Boosts transparency across the supply chain

 

Feature Highlights

Feature Area

What It Enables

Why It Matters

Warehouse execution

Pick/pack, wave management, dock scheduling, inventory movements

Smooth internal operations, less idle time

Transportation & dispatching

Route planning, dispatching, and execution

Better shipment coordination

Network collaboration

Real-time status, carrier integration, partner communication

Reduces blind spots, accelerates response

Appointment & dock scheduling

Dock/gate management

Reduces queuing, improves yard efficiency

AI automation (Joule)

Decision support, task automation

Frees up planners and boosts productivity

ERP integration

Out-of-the-box connectivity with SAP Cloud ERP

Minimizes custom development

Scalable deployment

Rapid implementation for smaller logistics nodes

Supports multi-tier logistics networks

 

Positioning Within the SAP Ecosystem

SAP positions this module as a bridge for distributed logistics operations, extending logistics capabilities to smaller or regional nodes. It complements, not replaces the SAP Extended Warehouse Management and SAP Transportation Management .

Where It Fits:

SAP Product

Complexity

Ideal For

Deployment

SAP EWM

High

Central hubs

On-prem / Cloud

SAP TM

High

Complex transport networks

On-prem / Cloud

SAP Logistics Management

Medium / Low

Regional / Satellite nodes

Cloud-native

Because it‚Äôs built on SAP BTP and integrates with SAP Business Network and Joule AI, the new module aligns with SAP‚Äôs vision of an intelligent, integrated supply chain.
SAP announced that general availability is expected in Q1 2026.

Benefits & Business Value

Adopting SAP Logistics Management can deliver both operational and strategic gains:

  1. Reduced operational friction: Unified logistics reduces manual handoffs and integration gaps.
  2. Faster deployment for regional nodes: Cloud-native architecture enables quicker rollouts and lower implementation costs.
  3. Improved visibility & collaboration: Real-time tracking and partner integration enhance transparency and agility.
  4. AI-driven decision support: Joule AI assists planners, automates routine actions, and reduces human error.
  5. Scalable, modular growth: Deploy gradually across logistics nodes without disrupting existing core systems.
  6. Resilient and agile operations: Respond faster to disruptions and maintain consistent service levels.
  7. Network consistency: Standardised processes and data across multiple logistics layers ensure global alignment.

Key Challenges & Considerations

While promising, success depends on thoughtful execution.
Organisations should anticipate and plan for:

  • Scope & complexity limits: The module is optimised for low-to-medium complexity; large hubs may still need EWM + TM.
  • Data integration & master data quality: Consistent, clean master data is critical for seamless performance.
  • Change management: AI-driven workflows require user adoption and training.
  • Phased rollout strategy: Identify pilot nodes and migration paths carefully.
  • Carrier & partner readiness: True collaboration depends on network adoption.
  • Monitoring & exception handling: Maintain human oversight during early automation phases.
  • Cost vs. ROI alignment: Evaluate expected efficiency gains against investment costs.

 

What Businesses Should Do Next

If your organization already runs SAP Cloud ERP or S/4HANA, this launch presents a real opportunity to modernise logistics without starting from scratch.

Recommended Next Steps

  • Map your logistics footprint: Identify which regional or satellite nodes would benefit most.
  • Start with pilot deployments: Test configurations, training, and ROI in smaller sites.
  • Ensure data readiness: Clean up and harmonize master data across materials, locations, and partners.
  • Engage carriers early: Align carriers and logistics partners with the collaboration network from the start.
  • Plan coexistence: Integrate with existing EWM/TM during the transition phase.
  • Adopt AI in stages: Roll out automation features gradually and monitor outcomes.
  • Track KPIs from day one: Measure order throughput, dock utilisation, exception rates, and on-time delivery.

Conclusion 

The introduction of SAP Logistics Management marks a pivotal step in SAP‚Äôs supply chain evolution - moving toward networked, intelligent, and modular logistics.

With its cloud-native architecture, AI-powered automation, and embedded collaboration, it offers a compelling value proposition for companies with multi-tier logistics footprints.

Ultimately, success will depend on data readiness, partner engagement, and phased adoption but for organisations ready to embrace intelligent logistics, SAP is clearly paving the way for smarter, more connected supply chains.

Thank you for reading.

entry.title: [Session Reply & Slides Available] Hot Topic: Joule Activation for SAP Cloud ERP (Public Edition)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Expertise Service Team and SAP AI RIG team recently co-present a deep-dive session focused on enabling ‚ÄåJoule‚Äå - SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot - for SAP Cloud ERP.

The agenda covered as below and feel free to access [Slides] [Recording]. 

  • Business AI capabilities and use cases
  • Joule‚Äôs technical architecture on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)
  • Step-by-step activation process for S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Q&A and live troubleshooting

1. Key Objectives‚Äå

  • Demonstrate Joule‚Äôs value in streamlining business processes (e.g., sales order management, issue resolution in status check).
  • Guide participants through end-to-end setup using BTP booster, destinations, and identity management.
  • Equip partners to deploy Joule for customers with minimal friction.

2. Business AI & Joule Introduction‚Äå

Joule Definition‚Äå
  • SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot embedded in cloud solutions to automate tasks, provide contextual insights, and reduce manual effort.
Primary Use Case‚Äå:
  • Navigational support (e.g., finding apps without memorizing transaction codes)
  • Transactional support (e.g., creating insights cards, resolving incomplete sales orders)
  • Informational support (e.g., find SAP Help document for relevant business process)
Demo Highlight
  • Create Insights Cards with Joule
  • Check Sales Order Status with Joule‚Äå:Joule identifies incomplete orders, highlights missing fields (e.g., payment terms), and guides users to resolve issues

3. Technical Architecture & Activation Flow‚Äå

3.1 Core Components‚Äå:

  • Joule Web Client‚Äå is embedded across SAP cloud solutions (e.g., SuccessFactors, S/4HANA)
  • BTP Subaccount‚Äå
    • Hosts Joule instance
    • SAP Build Work Zone
    • connectivity services
  • Cloud Identity Services‚Äå
    • Manages authentication (IAS)
    • Identity / role synchronization (IPS)
  • S/4HANA Cloud APIs‚Äå: Data source for Joule‚Äôs responses.

3.2 Activation Steps‚Äå:

Prerequisites‚Äå:
  • BTP global account with Joule entitlements
  • S/4HANA system registered to BTP
BTP Subaccount Setup‚Äå:
  • Create subaccount in preferred region/hyperscaler
  • Assign entitlements:
    • SAP Build Work Zone (foundation or standard edition)
    • Joule service
  • Establish trust to Cloud Identity Services tenant
  • Add S/4HANA domain to trusted destinations
Joule Booster Execution‚Äå:
  • Guided setup for BTP formations.
  • Integrate S/4HANA, Build Work Zone, and Cloud Identity Services
Post-Booster Configurations‚Äå:
  • Verify communication arrangements in S/4HANA (e.g., Digital Assistant Service - 0882).
  • Verify BTP Destinations
  • Verify SAP Build Work Zone Content for S/4HANA
  • Configure Identity Provisioning (IPS) to sync users/roles from S/4HANA to Build Work Zone
Validation‚Äå:
  • Ensure Joule icon appears in S/4HANA Launchpad.
  • Test capabilities (e.g., querying open sales orders).

4. Critical Notes & Pitfalls‚Äå

  • Trust Configuration‚Äå: Ensure all solutions in a Joule formation use the ‚Äåsame Cloud Identity Services tenant‚Äå.
  • Destination Errors‚Äå: Verify hostnames, client IDs, and secrets in navigation service manually if not auto-generated.
  • Identity Provisioning‚Äå: Ensure IPS jobs run successfully to propagate roles to SAP Build Work Zone.

5. Next Steps & Resources‚Äå

Discovery Center Missions:
  1. https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missiondetail/4538/4826/
  2. https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missiondetail/4452/4738/
Support Channels‚Äå:
  • SAP Community - Business AI 
  • SAP Support for technical errors.
Upcoming Sessions‚Äå:
  • Implement SAP Business AI for SAP Cloud ERP (Oct 27th)
  • Vietnam localization for implementation (Oct 28th)

entry.title: Exciting UX talks at TechEd ‚Äì Virtual, or meet us in Berlin and On The Road (USA, India, Australia)
entry.content:
For TechEd 2025 we have an exciting agenda lined up for all of you interested in SAP user experience. We not only have many interesting talks and hands-on sessions for creators (designer and developers) but also some talks showing our strategy and latest innovations for end users ‚Äì which hopefully will inspire you when creating your own applications!

With TechEd Virtual, you can watch some of these talks from wherever you are around the world. Here‚Äôs an overview of the talks which are primarily relevant for user experience, starting with TechEd Virtual, and then moving on to the individual locations.

For TechEd Virtual, Berlin and Bangalore: the main sub-tracks to look out for are:

  • Product and User Experience,
    in the Cloud Application (CA) track.
  • AI-driven user experiences with SAP Build,
    in the Application Development and Automation (AD) track.

TechEd Virtual

  • ST112v | AI and the future of product and user experience on the web and mobile (Strategy Talk ‚Äì 25 Min.)
  • CA201v | Creating AI-enhanced UX for your own applications with SAP Design System (Deep Dive ‚Äì 45 Min.)
  • ST116v | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools (Strategy Talk ‚Äì 25 Min.)
  • AD106v | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build (Deep Dive ‚Äì 45 Min.)
  • AD820v | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions (Road Map ‚Äì 25 Min.)

 

TechEd Berlin (and Bangalore)

All the sessions below are taking place in TechEd Berlin, and also TechEd On Tour Bangalore except the strategy sessions (which is available on-demand via TechEd Virtual), and the demo stations, since Bangalore has a different approach to providing demos.

Cloud Applications - Product and User Experience

  • ST112 | AI and the future of product and user experience on the web and mobile - Strategy Talk
  • CA811 | User and product experience innovations by SAP‚Äîon the web and mobile - Road Map
  • CA201 | Creating AI-enhanced UX for your own applications with SAP Design System - Deep Dive
  • CA261 | Create great UX with AI, SAP Design System, SAP Fiori elements, and SAPUI5 ‚Äì Hands-On
  • CA105 | Intelligent app development at scale with AI and SAP Fiori elements ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • CA262 | Analyze and optimize front-end application performance ‚Äì Hands-on
  • CA200 | An overview of our AI-enhanced mobile products across SAP Business Suite - Deep Dive
  • AD170 | Build scalable enterprise mobile solutions with SAP Build - Hands-on

In addition to the above talks, you can come and visit us at our demo station:

  • CA914 | AI-based user and product experience innovations on the web and mobile ‚Äì Demo station

Application Development and Automation

  • ST117 | SAP‚Äôs user experience strategy with SAP Build ‚Äì Strategy
  • ST116 | SAP Build for all: A shift toward AI-assisted developer-centric tools ‚Äì Strategy
  • AD818 | Explore the road map for user experience with SAP Build ‚Äì Road Map
  • AD820 | Future of app dev in SAP Build: Simplifying clean core and LoB extensions
  • AD106 | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • AD166 | Taking UI to the next level: Develop SAPUI5 with SAP Build ‚Äì Hands-on
  • AD200 | Unlocking the full potential of business users with SAP Build ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • AD165 | Build it yourself: Your modern digital workplace ‚Äì Hands-on
  • AD100 | SAP Joule for developers: How AI can boost your development in SAP Build ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • AD160 | Get hands-on with Joule: Boost your SAP Build development with AI ‚Äì Hands-on
  • AD201 | Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it for ABAP developers ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • AD163 | Fusion development with ABAP Cloud in SAP Build ‚Äì Hands-on
  • AD203 | Fact-checking UI extensibility on cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you ‚Äì Deep Dive
  • AD260 | UI extensibility on top of cloud and ABAP: What's in it for you ‚Äì Hands-on

The corresponding demo station is:

AD901 | SAP Build: AI agents, automations, and digital workspaces ‚Äì Demo station

For a comprensive overview of sessions relevant for SAPUI5 developers, including the abstracts, look at:

  • Join SAPUI5 Sessions at SAP TechEd 2025

Similarly, for an overview of all the sessions of interest for mobile development, including abstracts, see:

  • SAP TechEd 2025 - Go Mobile!!!

Joule and Agentic AI is of course also relevant for creating a great user experience, here are some recommended deep dives:

  • AI100 | Build custom AI solutions with the generative AI hub
  • AI103 | Integrating Joule with other tools such as WalkMe and Microsoft 365 Copilot
  • AI105 | Building custom AI agents and skills with Joule Studio

Usability Testing sessions on-site in Berlin

You can sign up to test one of these interesting topics in Berlin:

  1. Exploring Joule and voice ‚Äì understanding mobile AI in your daily work
  2. Redesigning the dashboard building experience with SAP Analytics Cloud
  3. Building AI agents with Joule Studio in SAP Build
  4. Vibe coding with SAP Build
  5. Accelerate your cloud implementation: Business configuration templates in SAP Central Business Configuration
  6. Supercharge your SAP Fiori elements app development with SAP Fiori tools and AI

Find out more and register for testing!

 

TechEd On Tour USA

ASUG Tech Connect  November 4 ‚Äì 6 in Louisville, Kentucky has a number of interesting talks and hands-on sessions for you. These are my selection of sessions related to SAP Fiori:

  • Creating Better User Experiences with AI-Powered SAP Fiori Apps
  • Using Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development
  • Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP
  • Explore ABAP Cloud in SAP Build: What's in it For ABAP Developers
  • Customer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe

Here are my selected Hands-on Lab sessions:

  • Get Started with ABAP Cloud for Classic ABAP Developers
  • Hands-on Lab: Explore Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities
  • Hands-on Lab: Build On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP

This blog post by Peter Spielvogel, who is a speaker there, gives an overview including abstracts:

  • UX and application development with AI at ASUG Tech Connect 2025 a companion event to SAP TechEd.

 

TechEd On Tour Australia

Mastering SAP, Sydney November 12 ‚Äì 14 in Sydney has these UX talks for you, each 45 minutes. The first one is unique to Sydney, by Jocelyn Dart, the other four are the same as in Berlin and Bangalore:

  • AD300 | SAP User Experience is the foundation for AI and Clean Core
  • AD301 | AI for App Development at Scale with SAP Design System & SAP Fiori Elements
  • AD302 | AI-Assisted User Experience Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP
  • AD106 | The art and science of SAPUI5 in SAP Build
  • AD200 | Unlocking the Full Potential of Business Users with SAP Build

These AI-related talks also sound relevant for UX:

  • AD202 | Agent building 101: All that you can do with Joule Studio
  • DT105 | SAP Business AI in SAP Cloud ERP

 

I myself will be in Berlin and Bangalore, giving the strategy talk, the road map talk and a deep-dive talk about creating apps with the SAP Design System (ST112,  CA811 and CA201 respectively).

  • Looking forward to meeting you!

entry.title: [2025-Q4] SAP BTP Adoption Webinars ‚Äì Unlock the Power of AI, Data, and Integration
entry.content:

  • Nov 19 | AI-Driven Business Solutions ‚Äì Exploring the Potential of SAP BTP AI - APAC/EMEA

üìÖ Oct 30 | Pipeline Concept in SAP Integration Suite

entry.title: AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 marks a significant leap forward in enterprise automation and intelligence, as presented in this product blog by @BeSchulze. This release, the result of two years of focused development, places artificial intelligence at the core ‚Äì seamlessly integrated across business areas to redefine how work gets done.

Central to this update is the new agentic AI framework, where task-specific agents work together under the orchestration of our copilot Joule. More than just assistance, SAP‚Äôs persona-based AI acts as the new interface ‚Äì guiding users through processes, answering questions, and delivering relevant insights within the tools they use every day. Customers can now experience improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simplified operations, with intelligent capabilities integrated directly into their business flow.

Dive into the accompanying video for a glimpse of how these AI-driven capabilities are transforming daily work and setting a new benchmark for enterprise management.

 

 

Agentic Use cases

Asset Management: Maintenance Planner

In the area of Asset Management, planning maintenance activities often requires seamless access to the right tools at the right time. The Maintenance Planner feature, newly integrated with Joule, enhances this process by providing direct navigation to scheduling applications within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. This innovation means that maintenance planners no longer need to sift through catalogs, as they can intuitively access relevant apps directly from their conversations, such as asking, "How to visualize maintenance work?" and receiving immediate links to resource scheduling applications. By embedding SAP Help documentation into Joule‚Äôs conversational responses, planners gain quick insights and can focus more on optimally scheduling maintenance tasks, thus ensuring that assets are well-managed without the hassle of navigation detours.

Eager to learn more? Check out our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Finance: Simpliyfying invoice dispute with the dispute manager

Untangling an incorrect invoice can feel like detective work, searching for clues across different systems. Now, with the Dispute Manager agent in SAP Cloud ERP Private your finance team has a new partner. A finance expert can simply ask Joule to pull up a dispute case by its number or show recent invoices for a customer. From that single conversation, they can review the details and then instruct Joule to either reject the dispute or navigate them directly to the app to create a credit note. This conversational approach turns a complex, multi-step investigation into a streamlined and guided dialogue. It not only saves valuable time for your team but also leads to quicker resolutions, helping maintain positive customer relationships.

For more information, please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance: Empowering Trade Classification with an AI Agent  

Imagine trying to import a new fitness tracker and facing a complex web of customs classifications, where one wrong choice could mean costly delays. The Joule Agent for Trade Classification in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 makes this task straightforward by analyzing your product's data against global customs rules. For example, it might conclude a fitness tracker falls under the wristwatches category and provide legal notes to back this decision, keeping your team informed and in control. By transforming the complex classification process into a guided interaction, your trade professionals have more time to focus on strategy rather than paperwork. This not only enhances the speed and accuracy of your compliance processes but also strengthens your ability to meet market demands swiftly. With this AI innovation, your business can confidently and efficiently pursue global growth, minimizing delays and maximizing opportunities.

To learn more, consult our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Sales LoB

Elevating sales efficiency with AI-driven solution quotation management

Speaking of the Sales line of business, where time is of the essence, managing solution quotations can be a complex task. The introduction of Joule as a digital assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 simplifies this process by allowing sales reps to execute tasks like creation, updating, and searching of solution quotations with conversational, natural language commands. This empowers sales teams to focus on high-value opportunities, such as quotations about to expire or those with significant client interest, and make well-informed decisions with clarity and speed. By streamlining the access to critical information, Joule helps reduce operational time and enhances the agility of sales professionals, allowing them to concentrate on building stronger customer relationships and fulfilling sales targets.

 

 

For more information read our dedicated pages on performing release and acceptance of solution quotations and fetching solution quotation information.

 

Seamlessly creating billing documents with AI

Imagine transforming the intricate process of billing document creation into an efficient, effortless operation‚Äîthis is where Joule steps in. The AI-powered capabilities of Joule allow users to effortlessly generate billing documents, whether they stem from a single reference or a collection of sales and delivery documents. This intuitive system supports the creation of both individual and collective billing documents, tailored to meet diverse business needs with pinpoint accuracy. For R&D departments, this means a streamlined workflow where administrative overhead is minimized, allowing more focus on innovation and product development. By simplifying navigation and enabling quick access to essential apps like Display Billing Documents, Joule enhances the accuracy and efficiency of billing processes, paving the way for more strategic decision-making. With this kind of intelligent assistance, your team spends less time on the nitty-gritty and more time driving the business forward.

 For more details, consult the SAP Help Portal.

 

Sourcing & Procurement LoB

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions 

Let‚Äôs take a look at the Sourcing & Procurement Line of Business. In this area creating purchase requisitions is a task that demands accuracy and efficiency. With the AI-assisted capabilities of Joule, the process becomes intuitive, allowing users, particularly casual ones, to navigate and complete requisitions merely through conversational prompts. This smart assistance helps in understanding various languages, correcting misspelled data, and even suggesting sources of supply promptly, thereby minimizing manual overhead and enhancing speed in decision-making. By embracing the future potential of speech recognition, Joule promises to make procurement tasks even more seamless, supporting operational purchasers in reducing free text entries and ensuring order clarity.

 For more details, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance LoB

Simplified subscription order management*

In Finance, is often fragmented and error-prone. Teams spend valuable time reconciling contracts, processing changes, and ensuring compliance - effort that slows down financial operations and puts transparency at risk.

Joule tackles this challenge by simplifying subscription management end to end. It guides users through creating orders, automatically filling key fields once core details are entered. Contract information is easy to access and aligned with attributes like customer or product ID, while intuitive summaries provide quick snapshots of activation status. By streamlining these steps, Joule boosts efficiency, improves transparency, and allows businesses to focus on growth rather than administrative tasks.

 

For more information, consult the SAP Help Portal.  

 

Joule for cash management assistant*

Picture your finance team, once bogged down in manual cash flow tracking, now effortlessly navigating a sea of numbers with ease. With Joule, you can quickly verify if due bank statements are received, fetch opening balances, and factor in expected cash flows, all in one seamless process. By providing accurate calculations of expected closing balances, Joule proactively alerts you to potential cash shortages or surpluses. This efficiency not only saves substantial time but also empowers you to optimize cash usage strategically. In a world where timing is everything, having this level of clarity allows your business to maintain a robust financial footing and seize opportunities as they arise. 

 

 

For more details, refer to the SAP Help Portal. 

*planned availability in November 2025  with the  update of Joule framework

Supply Chain LoB

Joule navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management

In managing warehouse operations, finding the right tools quickly can make all the difference between seamless or sluggish performance. With the introduction of Joule copilot navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management, SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 enhances user experience by guiding employees effortlessly to the most suitable applications for their tasks. This AI-driven assistance not only accelerates warehouse processes but also minimizes the need for extensive user training, ensuring employees can focus on their core responsibilities rather than app navigation. The real value lies in the comprehensive insights this innovation provides, empowering users to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency across operations.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Service Management LoB

Creating follow-ups for in-house service objects with Joule

Now let‚Äôs have a look at the Service Management LoB. Here, Joule's AI-driven capabilities enable service managers to easily search, display, and create follow-ups for in-house service objects using conversational interactions. This human-centric approach optimizes daily tasks by allowing managers to seamlessly access critical information and act upon it without the need for complex navigation. By streamlining these processes, service management teams can focus on what truly matters‚Äîdelivering quality service to their customers. Such enhancements in task efficiency lead to more responsive service operations, ensuring a proactive approach toward managing service demands.

 

 

For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Research and Development LoB

Intelligent project assistant capabilities with Joule

Navigating through a sea of data is commonplace in Research and Development (R&D) area, yet it doesn't have to be a drain on your team's creativity and productivity. The intelligent project assistant capabilities powered by Joule allow users to derive project data through natural language inquiries without the hassle of navigating multiple applications. This ease of access aids in quickly retrieving updates on project changes, identifying missing parts, and tracking due activities, all through Joule‚Äôs conversational interface. By supporting informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, Joule transforms project management into a streamlined process, helping teams stay focused on innovation rather than administrative tasks. Moreover, the ability to open projects and WBS elements directly through Joule means that users can engage with their data more efficiently, fostering a productive and satisfied work environment. With these enhancements, businesses can ensure that their R&D projects are not only well managed but also effectively advancing toward their goals.

 

Navigating Bill of Materials with Joule

Imagine a workspace, where accessing Bill of Materials (BoM) is as straightforward as asking a colleague for the latest update, that's the seamless interaction Joule brings to the table. This AI-assisted natural language capability supports end users in navigating and managing BoM scenarios with ease, removing previous barriers to information. With Joule, users can effortlessly access header information, query BoMs by material-plant combinations, and select specific items, all through simple conversational prompts. Such simplification boosts productivity, allowing R&D teams to devote more time to product innovation and less to administrative navigation. By transforming BoM management into an intuitive, efficient process, Joule empowers users to make informed decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and ultimately driving business success.

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

AI-Enabled Precision in Handling Change Records

In Research and Development, managing change records is often time-consuming and complex. Teams must sift through detailed information, track overdue items, and ensure compliance ‚Äì all of which takes attention away from innovation.

Imagine handling change records as effortlessly as discussing project milestones with your team ‚Äì this is the transformative experience Joule brings to R&D operations. Joule simplifies interactions around change records, offering users intuitive access to detailed information at both header and item levels. By expediting the summarization process and enabling status changes, Joule ensures that overdue change records are discovered and addressed promptly, promoting efficient workflow and compliance. The capability to find records based on criteria such as product and reason for change further streamlines the management process, enabling teams to focus on innovation rather than paperwork. With these enhancements, R&D departments can make informed decisions more swiftly, driving their projects forward with the confidence that change management is both smooth and reliable.

 

For more details, refer to the dedicated pages on summarizing change record information and fetching change record information.

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Streamlined project financials with Joule‚Äôs AI assistance

Handling complex financial data is one of the biggest hurdles in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. Now, picture managing a multifaceted project with the ease of a friendly chat ‚Äì that‚Äôs the vision Joule brings to life. With enhanced project assistant capabilities, Joule enables users to seamlessly access project financial and master data through intuitive natural language interactions. Gone are the days of toggling through applications and complex reports; now, project system users can effortlessly retrieve and summarize financial insights, aligning their focus on high-value tasks. This AI-driven ease not only boosts user satisfaction but also streamlines data collection and consolidation, making project management more efficient and effective. As a result, project teams can better navigate financial landscapes, ensuring that each decision supports the strategic vision. By leveraging Joule‚Äôs summarization and analytical prowess, organizations can enhance precision in project financial control, translating insights into impactful actions.


For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal. 

 

Summary

As we have explored, the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release introduces a transformative suite of AI-driven innovations that redefine what‚Äôs possible in enterprise operations. By harnessing the power of specialized agentic AI and Joule, businesses are now equipped to navigate complexities with clarity and precision, leading to optimized processes and strategic growth. We‚Äôre excited for you to experience these advancements firsthand and to see how they can empower your organization to achieve its goals with new-found efficiency and insight. Thank you for joining us on this journey through the future of intelligent enterprise solutions. Stay connected for more updates by following the with the PSCC_Enablement tag as we continue to innovate and shape the path forward for businesses worldwide. Don't forget to follow me (@Yannick_PTT) in the community as well as on LinkedIn to not miss any updates and insights.

For more information on intelligent capabilities integrated SAP Cloud ERP Private, explore the SAP Help Portal. 

More information

  • What‚Äôs New Viewer
  • From Innovation to Impact: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release (SAP News Center)
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Community
  • Help Portal SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • What`s New for Joule Capabilities

  • SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025

entry.title: Exploring Business Partner Master Data with SAP Joule, the AI Co-pilot
entry.content:
In today‚Äôs ever-evolving business landscape, quick access to business partners and their specific details is crucial for success. But this can be tedious and time-consuming when you have a lot of master data objects, especially when you want to quickly fetch some specific information related to a section of the master data without having to open the FIORI app and click through multiple facets in the user interface to locate the required information.

With the latest update of SAPJoule in October 2025, Business Partner master data brings you the power of AI. With Joule's robust functionality, you can easily access and view detailed information about your Business Partners, enhancing your ability to make informed decisions and streamline operations. This blog post explores how Joule can become your go-to assistant for easily accessing Business Partners efficiently.

 

A Closer Look at Business Partners

Joule offers features that allow users to delve into various aspects of Business Partner data. With Joule, you can explore:

  • Overview: Quickly access a summary of key information about your Business Partners.
  • Basic Details: Review fundamental data points, including organisation title and identifying search terms.
  • Roles: Understand the roles your Business Partners fulfil and their associated descriptions.
  • Addresses: Examine details of maintained and standard addresses across regions.
  • Industries: Gain insights into the industry classifications of your Business Partners.
  • Relationships: Explore the interconnected web of relationships between your Business Partners.

 

Joule‚Äôs Requirements

Before diving into Joule's capabilities, ensure you meet the prerequisites for access. You must be assigned the business role: SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST to leverage Joule.

 

Practical Use Cases for Business Partners

Display Business Partner Overview

Kickstart your exploration by asking Joule to show you an overview of a Business Partner. For instance, entering the Joule prompt, "Display Business Partner Overview" followed by specifying an ID such as ‚Äú10238179‚Äù, will yield an informative card with essential details like Full Name, Business Partner ID, Category, and Communication Details.

 

Joule knows what else you might need

You read that right! Joule right away brings up the relevant supported details of the business partner in the form of quick links.

 

All that you must do is click any of the navigational links to view the corresponding details of the business partner. Everything in the same conversation window with Joule!

Joule also provides you with the navigation to the app where the business partner is stored. With just a click, you can open the object to view all its details or edit it to make changes.

Now let‚Äôs speed up things. What if you don‚Äôt want to go step by step. You know the business partner's number, and you quickly want to view some specific information. Well, Joule does that too!

 

Dive into Basic Details

To uncover foundational insights, ask Joule, "Show me basic data of business partner 10238179." This query retrieves critical information, including Authorization Group and Archiving Flags.

Unveiling Roles

Discover the various roles a Business Partner plays in your organisation by requesting Joule to "Display roles of business partner 10238179." Learn about the roles, their descriptions, and their validity periods.

 

Navigating Addresses

Addresses are pivotal in maintaining smooth communication. By querying "Display addresses of business partner 10238179," you can access all address entries and their specifics, ensuring that communication remains seamless.

Industry Insights

To understand the industry dynamics, ask Joule to ‚ÄúFor BP 10238179, show me industry details‚Äù. This reveals the Business Partner‚Äôs industry designations and systems.

Exploring Relationships

The intricate network of relationships is crucial for operational success. Joule can help display all related business partners by querying "Display relationship of BP 10238179," providing insights into all maintained relationships. Furthermore, for each related business partner, Joule reveals the Relationship Category, validity, and associated fields based on the relationship category.

 

Practical Use Cases for Customer Master Data

Display Customer Overview

Initiate your exploration of customer master data by querying an overview. Simply start with "Show me customers overview," and specify a Customer ID such as ‚Äú1007885‚Äù for detailed insights. Joule retrieves essential information like full name, Customer ID, and contact details.

 

It works the same way as that of Business Partner. Quick links help you fetch more relevant details about the Customer master data.

 

Navigate Customer Information

Dive further with specific queries like, "Show me customer information for 1023060," to uncover details such as account group, authorization group, order block, and classification indicators.

Exploring Sales Area Dynamics

To view a customer‚Äôs sales area specifics, ask Joule, "Display sales area of customer 1023060." For further exploration into individual sales areas, a query such as "Display sales area details of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00" reveals insights like sales office locations, shipping condition, and payment terms.

Tax Data Delve

Tax considerations are crucial. By querying, "Display tax data of customer 1023060 with sales area 1010 10 00," you can access location-specific tax classifications and descriptions.

 

Financial Engagement: Company Code and Dunning

Explore financial coordination by asking Joule for company code details, with queries like "Display company code of customer 1023060." At the same time, examining dunning data can optimize collections ‚Äì ‚ÄúDisplay dunning data of customer 1023060 with company code 4040" provides detailed procedural insights.

 

Conclusion

With this update, you can leverage Joule to access Business Partner and Customer objects. You can soon expect Joule for Supplier objects too.

Empower your business with Joule's capabilities and streamline your operations by effectively accessing Business Partner information. Whether it‚Äôs for ensuring precise communication or gaining industry insights, Joule stands ready to assist.

Embark on your journey with Joule today and redefine how you effectively access business partner and customer master data for success.

entry.title: UX and application development with AI at ASUG Tech Connect 2025 a companion event to SAP TechEd
entry.content:
This year, SAP TechEd has several options to allow you to learn about the latest SAP technologies and how to apply them to your organization. In addition to TechEd in Berlin and the virtual option, there are ‚ÄúSAP TechEd On Tour‚Äù events in Louisville, Sydney, and Bangalore. In this post, I‚Äôll share the sessions on application development and user experience that we are presenting at ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, Kentucky. As you would expect many have AI -assisted capabilities to make both business users and developers more productive.

 

At ASUG Tech Connect, we have both lectures and hands-on workshops.

Lectures are a chance to hear from SAP experts and have your questions answered in the room.

Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP (Jens Weiler)
Explore on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. Extend standard apps and manage custom ones in SAP Cloud ERP and explore transactional, analytical, and integration use cases like the extensibility AI assistant, queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, and SQL services.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 11:15 AM-12:05 PM

What‚Äôs Next: AI-First Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite (Ullas Holla, Peter Spielvogel)
Get a fast-paced look at how SAP is embedding AI and delivering cross-suite innovations that break down silos and speed up decision-making. We‚Äôll cover the latest highlights from releases of SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite‚Äîplus give you a sneak peek at what‚Äôs coming in 2026 and beyond.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 3:30 PM-4:20 PM

Customer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe (Brian Galloway, Dario Cruz)
This session covers the end-to-end development workflow in the RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition environment using Eclipse ABAP Development Tools (ADT). It demonstrates how to define a data source and expose it via a CDS view, enabling consumption through SAP Fiori elements, Eclipse ADT, and Postman. A live demo illustrates the creation of a simple SAPUI5 application that consumes the same OData service and is deployed to the SAP Fiori Launchpad, showcasing full-stack integration from backend data modeling to frontend delivery.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-9:30 AM

Using Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development (Ullas Holla)
AI changes everything, especially for developing business applications. See how SAP‚Äôs latest coding agents let you build SAP Fiori elements apps using a conversational interface. Create apps using Joule, including a CAP service, sample data, and SAPUI5 customizations.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 4:10 PM-5:00 PM

Creating Better User Experiences with AI-Powered SAP Fiori Apps (Peter Spielvogel)
Discover how the latest AI features in SAP Fiori apps enhance user productivity and streamline onboarding. Starting with My Home and diving into commonly used SAP Fiori apps, see how AI simplifies information access, supports informed business decisions, and fosters seamless collaboration. Explore how conversational interactions are making SAP more intuitive than ever.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 4:15 PM-5:05 PM

Hands-on workshops give you the opportunity to test the latest SAP innovations and gain access to the same tools and technologies we use to build apps for SAP S/4HANA.

Hands-on Lab: Get Started with ABAP Cloud for Classic ABAP Developers
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Explore how similar development works with ABAP Cloud using the ABAP RESTful application programming model. Use ABAP Cloud to build cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default‚Äîon SAP Business Technology Platform and in any edition of SAP S/4HANA.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 1:10 PM-3:10 PM

Hands-on Lab: Explore Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities
Learn how to develop transactional applications using the ABAP RESTful application model in ABAP Cloud while leveraging Joule capabilities for ABAP developers.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-10:00 AM

Hands-on Lab: Build On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP
Discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You can explore how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch while getting practical insights through exercises
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Hands-on Lab: Modernize Classic Extensions for Clean Core in SAP Cloud ERP Private
Practice clean core extensibility in SAP Cloud ERP Private. Learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP test cockpit, and how to use the ABAP Cloud development model and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Discovery Workshop: Start Your AI Agent Journey by Exploring AI Agent Use Cases 
In this discovery workshop, you will learn how AI Agents function and what makes a strong use case. You will identify and prioritize strategic AI Agent use cases for your business. For your selected use case, you will explore how AI Agent capabilities can address your specific business challenges and learn the next steps for designing and building an AI Agent using the SAP Agent Builder.
Thursday November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

I hope you can join us.

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture
entry.content:
A couple of words about me: 

My name is Sunny Kapoor and I am a lead product manager for the cloud integration capability of SAP Integration Suite, specializing in enterprise-wide business process integration and digital transformation. With 15 years of professional experience, I offer a comprehensive understanding of both technical implementation and strategic product oversight.

My Session: 

IN162 | Real-time data for AI agents: Grounding with event-driven architecture | Tuesday, Nov 4 | 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM CET

What you will learn about: 

This session introduces attendees to the power of event-driven integration pattern to deliver real-time grounding data, equipping AI system's with the latest business context to make informed and accurate decisions.

AI Grounding is the process of connecting an AI system's abstract knowledge and responses to specific, real-world data and context, reducing "hallucinations" and increasing the reliability and accuracy of its outputs.

 
This session focuses into the advanced realm of real-time vector grounding, where you'll connect structured enterprise data to a large language model using SAP HANA Cloud‚Äôs vector database, SAP Integration Suite, and Advanced Event Mesh. Experience firsthand how dynamic data updates can enhance the model's responses in real time, maintaining their contextual precision. By session's end, you'll have constructed an end-to-end, event-driven flow that responds to new sales order events from SAP S/4HANA Cloud and support case events from SAP Service Cloud Version 2, providing an AI assistant with live contextual intelligence. This hands-on scenario simulates an AI-powered Customer Success Digital Assistant, equipping it with real-time sales and support data to deliver accurate insights and informed decision-making capabilities.

Co-speakers:

Prashant Gautam, Senior Product Manager, has been with SAP since 2004. With strong focus on innovation, he works on advancing Artificial Intelligence capabilities in SAP Integration Suite, driving efficiency and modernisation in integration space.

 

Karsten Strothmann is lead product manager and evangelist for event-driven integration at SAP SE in Walldorf, Germany. With over 25 years of experience in the software industry, he has extensively focused on Event-Driven Architecture (EDA) and its implementation at the enterprise level.

 

Piyush Gakhar heads the cross product management & strategy for Integration solutions such as SAP Integration Suite, API Management, Event Mesh & SAP Process Orchestration.

 

 

Take a look at our overall SAP Integration Suite sessions üëá 

https://community.sap.com/t5/sap-teched-blog-posts/shape-what-s-next-with-sap-integration-suite-at-teched-2025/ba-p/14220264 

Other related sessions I recommend:  

You can also gain some further knowledge around SAP Integration Suite and SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh by attending the following SAP TechEd sessions:

  • IN103 | Helping systems talk smarter with a flexible event-driven architecture
    • Deep Dive
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 2:15 PM - 3:00 PM CET
  • IN165 | Experience event-driven integration with advanced event mesh
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Thursday, Nov 6 | 11:30 AM - 1:30 PM CET
  • IN160 | Empower your business through enterprise automation
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM CET
  • IN163 | Implement exactly once in-order delivery in SAP Integration Suite
    • Hands-on Workshop
    • When: Wednesday, Nov 5 | 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET

Related community topic pages: 

  •  SAP Integration Suite
  • Joule 

Looking forward to seeing you: 

Join to learn how event-driven integration patterns can keep AI systems contextually aware and up-to-date with the latest business information.

Now let‚Äôs hear from you:

We‚Äôd love to hear your thoughts on the concept of real-time data grounding using evet-driven architecture. Share your insights and ideas by answering these questions in the comments below:

  • In what ways do you think real-time vector grounding can enhance the capabilities of AI Agents.
  • How do you plan to apply the skills and knowledge gained from this workshop to your ongoing or future projects?

Let's start a conversation and learn from each other's perspectives! 

Don't forget to register for the workshop to secure your spot and join us for this hands-on learning experience!

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. This is the leading event for developers and IT professionals ready to explore SAP's most transformative technologies and emerge with skills that deliver measurable impact from day one.

SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Berlin (November 4-6, 2025) offers the flagship in-person experience where you'll connect directly with SAP experts, participate in hands-on workshops, and build lasting professional relationships within the global SAP community
  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.

  • ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, KY (November 4-6) focuses on practical skills for North American practitioners

entry.title: SAP Ariba Supplier Management & Risk 2511 Release Key Innovations Preview
entry.content:
New Transactional Use Cases for Approvals and Navigational Use Cases for AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance (SLP-2288)

This feature adds navigational use cases for viewing supplier data and performing common supplier management activities, and transactional use cases for approvals, in SAP Ariba Supplier Lifecycle and Performance with AI copilot Joule. Users can get assistance from Joule for viewing supplier profiles, creating supplier request and modular questionnaire projects, finding out approval status for projects where they're an approver, and finding the projects that are pending their approval.

 
This feature adds the following capabilities in Joule for supplier management:

Use Case Type

Use Case

Description

Example

Transactional

Tasks still pending approval

Displays a list of tasks pending approval by the current user, with options for approving or denying the tasks in Joule. Results include matching tasks in all project types. There's currently no way to filter the list by project type.

Tasks in some supplier management projects also support a Request Additional Info option. You must navigate to the task details page if you want to use this option rather than approving or denying the task.

Show me tasks pending approval

Transactional

Check approval status

Displays the approval status and currently active approvers of the specified task. You must include the task's ID in the question

Check approval status for task TSK1234567

Navigational

View a supplier's profile

Displays the matching supplier or suppliers. Choose Open in App to view the supplier's profile. To find suppliers by ID, you must include the supplier's SM vendor ID in the question.

Show me the profile for supplier 12345678

Show me the profile for supplier ABC

Navigational

Create a supplier request

Displays a Create supplier request in app quick link that opens the supplier request form or questionnaire configured for your site, if you have permission to create supplier requests. The link opens either the standard supplier request or the Dun & Bradstreet-integrated supplier request, depending on which one your organization uses.

Take me to the page for creating a supplier request

Navigational

Send modular questionnaires to suppliers

Displays a Send modular questionnaires in app quick link that opens the first page in the workflow for inviting suppliers to standalone modular questionnaires, if you have permission to create modular questionnaire projects.

Take me to the page for creating a modular questionnaire

View implementation details and more here.

 

Ability to Exclude System Generated Versions during ERP sync Internal and External Registrations (SLP-2310)

This feature ensures a new questionnaire version is only created if ERP sync changes the vendor mapped questions of the current active version, preventing unnecessary versions and maintaining clarity in version tracking in registration questionnaire only. (This feature is applicable only to supplier registration.)

View implementation details and more here.

 

New User Research Panel Link in the User Feedback Survey (SLP-2333)

When users complete the feedback survey, they now see a new user research panel link on the thank you page. The link allows users to sign up for the SAP User Research Panel, where they can engage with SAP and provide product feedback.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Changes to the User Interface

After a user submits a completed feedback survey, the thank you page now includes a SAP User Research Panel link. Choosing the link opens a sign-up form for the panel.

View implementation details and more here.

 

AI Copilot Joule in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk (SRISK-1848)

Joule, SAP's generative AI copilot, is now available in SAP Ariba Supplier Risk. Joule uses a conversational interface to help users complete tasks efficiently. It leverages generative and other AI technologies to understand natural language requests, identify intent, perform actions, and provide insights. Using generative AI, it can execute tasks, deliver tailored responses, and summarize information effectively.

View implementation details and more here.

 

New Country/Region Risk Provider (SRISK-1833)

A new default country/region risk provider, Moody‚Äôs Analytics, is available to include up to date country/region risk information in your risk exposure. 

Including the country/region risk as a contributing factor to risk exposure for suppliers allows organizations to make more informed business decisions. The country/region risk exposure is displayed on the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard and in the supplier 360¬∞ profile.

Currently, SAP Ariba Supplier Risk uses country risk score data from the World Economic Forum (WEF) as the default source of information. With this enhancement, Moody‚Äôs Analytics becomes the default source of country risk score data.

Moody‚Äôs Analytics Country/Region Risk Index compares investment risk across 191 countries, provides a single country risk score, is updated quarterly, and aggregates threats along six risk dimensions:

  1. Macroeconomic risk

  2. Business risk

  3. Financial risk

  4. Social risk

  5. Political risk

  6. Security risk

Changes to the User Interface

  • On the SAP Ariba Supplier Risk dashboard, the Country/Region score (WEF) column in the Your Suppliers section is now changed to Country/Region score (Moody's).

  • On the supplier profile page, the Risk Exposure tab on the Risk menu displays Moody's risk categories.

  • Any other text or link that references the World Economic Forum (WEF) is now replaced with Moody's.

View implementation details and more here.

 
 

SAP Spend Control Tower - Feature highlights

Data Quality Analytics Dashboards (ARBARE-157)

This feature enables you to analyze the accuracy, completeness, and consistency of spend data loaded from source systems into SAP Spend Control Tower in the Data Quality dashboard. 
Examples of the User Interface:
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
View implementation details and more here.
 

Manage Spend Taxonomy Enhancements (ARBTS-215)

This feature includes enhancements that enable you to expand your custom taxonomy by adding new categories, moving categories, and mapping additional UNSPSC codes.
 
You can now add a new custom category to support new products, map it to a unique UNSPSC level 4 code, and validate changes via SAP Spend Control Tower to prevent duplicates. Additionally, you can move custom taxonomy categories, along with their subtrees, to a new parent, which updates roll-ups for display and dashboards without altering item-level classifications or UNSPSC mappings. Unused UNSPSC codes can also be added to any custom leaf node to extend the taxonomy.
 

Changes to the User Interface

The Spend Taxonomy tab on the custom taxonomy page includes the following new buttons:

  • Add Categories

  • Add UNSPSC Mappings

  • Move To

 
 
 
 
 
View implementation details and more here.
 

Multi-Field Search for Invoice Item Categorization (ARBTS-95)

This feature enables you to evaluate and confirm proper invoice line item categorization using the new Invoice Items View on the Review Invoice Items Categorization page, which streamlines identifying items for review and applying consistent categorization.

The Invoice Items View lists aggregated invoice items and provides a multi-functional search to help you find items that need review. You can also save search criteria and apply a saved search to filter invoice items.

Review Invoice Items Categorization - Grouped View 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

View implementation details and more here.

 

Spend Analysis Benchmarks ‚Äî Company vs Industry Performance (ANALYSIS-1324)

This feature enables you to view a comparative analysis of year-to-date company spend values and the industry averages along with the deviations for various spend categories in the Spend Analysis Benchmarks ‚Äî Company vs Industry Performance dashboard.

SAP Spend Control Tower uses anonymized historical data to develop benchmarks for supplier spend and category spend. This data is used to create a benchmark report.

The Spend Analysis Benchmarks ‚Äî Company vs Industry Performance dashboard provides insights into your company‚Äôs spend performance. It enables you to:

  • Compare spend performance across your enterprise, for example by company code or location, against the average and best performer within your company.

  • Compare your overall enterprise spend performance to industry peers, including the industry average and top performers in each area.

 

 

 

View implementation details and more here.

 

Stay connected with your community for more insights and updates:

  • Register for the Early Release Series for 2511 release- Multi-registration link and for CIM customers- P2P link 
  • Feature related materials:
    • SAP Ariba Connect - Release Readiness (Customers except CIM)
    • Readiness Community page (For CIM customers)
  • SAP Community for Intelligent Spend Management page
  • SAP Help Portal pages - Procurement  
  • What‚Äôs New
